intro: Ilex corallina var. loeseneri, commonly known as the Loesener's holly, is a variant of the coral holly native to the southeastern United States. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that turn reddish in the fall. The plant produces small, white flowers in the spring, followed by bright red berries that are an important food source for birds. Its compact growth habit and ornamental foliage make it a popular choice for landscaping. It thrives in well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight.
